KEs.batchUploadContinueText: Click here to go to it, or click continue below to truly put all these documents into one KE

restrictedMsg.heading: It looks like your account does not have permission to view the knowledge entries. If you need access, please reach out to your system administrator for assistance.

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.caption: Add relevant keywords to make this entry easier to find.
keywords.placeholder: e.g. (Employee Benefits, Leave policy, Payroll Issues)

assignAccess.heading: Assign Access
assignAccess.infoText: Admin and Super Admin can View and Modify Its KE
assignAccess.confirmMessage: Are you sure you want to discard these permission changes?

giveAccessToAllUsers.label: Give Access to All Users
giveAccessToAllUsers.helpInfo: Selecting this option grants view access to all users in the organization. No further restrictions or configurations are required, and everyone within the organization will have access to this Knowledge Entry.
giveAccessToAllUsers.caption: Allows all users to view this Knowledge Entry.

giveAccessByAttributeOrName.label: Give Access by Attribute or Name
giveAccessByAttributeOrName.byAttributeCaption: Assign view access to users by attributes.
giveAccessByAttributeOrName.byAttributeHelpInfo: This option allows you to grant view access to users based on specific criteria. You can filter users by selected attributes, and only those who match the chosen criteria will have view access to the Knowledge Entry.
giveAccessByAttributeOrName.byNameCaption: Manually assign access to selected users from the organization.
giveAccessByAttributeOrName.byNameHelpInfo: This option allows you to grant view access to specific users by selecting them individually. You can manually search and choose users, and only those selected will have view access to the Knowledge Entry.

giveEditingPermission.label: Give Editing Permission
giveEditingPermission.onlyAdminsCaption: Allows all users with super admin and admin roles to edit this Knowledge Entry.
giveEditingPermission.onlyAdminsHelpInfo: This option grants edit access to all users with super admin and admin roles, enabling them to modify the Knowledge Entry.
giveEditingPermission.allQueueSupporters: Give Edit Access to All Queue Supporters
giveEditingPermission.allQueueSupportersCaption: Allows all users with a queue supporter role to edit this Knowledge Entry.
giveEditingPermission.allQueueSupportersHelpInfo: This option grants edit access to all users with a queue supporter role. All users in this role will be able to modify the Knowledge Entry.
giveEditingPermission.queueSupportersByName: Give Edit Access to Queue Supporters by Name
giveEditingPermission.queueSupportersByNameCaption: Manually assign edit permissions to selected queue supporters.
giveEditingPermission.queueSupportersByNameHelpInfo: This option allows you to grant edit access to specific queue supporters by selecting them individually. You can manually search and choose queue supporters, and only those selected will have edit access to the Knowledge Entry.

versionSelectionModal.heading: Choose the version of the knowledge entry to edit

analyzing-documents.title: Analyzing Documents
analyzing-documents.caption2: We are creating knowledge entries for you!

bulk-upload.title: Upload Files (Documents, Images, Videos, and More)

singleKE.title: What is KE?
singleKE.subtitle: A Knowledge Entry (KE) is a unit where you store relevant information and documents.

step1.title: Purpose
step1.text1: Focused Entries: Ideal for creating a single Knowledge Entry (KE) where the user needs to provide detailed and specific information for one topic or document.
step1.text2: Customization: Allows for precise customization, including selecting the language and adding specific details relevant to that single KE.

step2.title: Purpose
step2.text1: Single Document or Topic: When uploading or managing just one document or a specific topic.
step2.text2: Detailed Information: When the user needs to provide extensive details and a clear description for that particular KE.
step2.text3: Language Selection: When the user needs to provide extensive details and a clear description for that particular KE.

bulkKE.title: Why use Bulk Upload?
bulkKE.subtitle: â€˜Bulk Uploadâ€™ allows you to take a number of files, and create a Knowledge Entry (KE) from each file.

step1.title: Purpose
step1.text1: Efficiency: Designed for handling large volumes of documents quickly and efficiently.
step1.text2: Automated Language Detection: Automatically detects the language of documents, which is convenient when uploading multiple files in different languages.

step2.title: When to Use
step2.text1: Multiple Documents: When the user has several documents to upload at once and wants to save time by avoiding repetitive tasks.
step2.text2: Streamlined Process: Useful for situations where documents are related but need to be categorized into separate KEs.
step2.text3: Batch Operations: Provides options to save as draft or create KEs in bulk, enhancing productivity.

step3.title: How to Perform a Bulk Upload
step3.text1: Drag & Drop: Upload multiple files by dragging and dropping them into the upload area.
step3.text2: File Management: After uploading, you can delete any file if needed
step3.text3: No Merging: Files cannot be merged into a single KE. Each file will be processed individually
step3.text4: AI Analysis: Our AI will analyze each document
step3.text5: Title Creation: AI will suggest a title for each KE based on document content. You can edit the title, change the document, or delete it
step3.text6: Save or Publish: You can choose to save all the entries as drafts or publish them immediately

warning.title: You're about to publish this Knowledge Entry with these current access settings.
warning.sub-title: Would you like to modify them before publishing?

feedbackVote.title: Feedback on Response/ Downvote & No Downvote
feedbackVote.widgetHeaderTitle: Feedback on Response/ Downvote & No Downvote
feedbackVote.infoTitle: This section provides insights into user feedback on responses. Upvotes indicate user approval, while Downvotes reflect dissatisfaction. If No Vote is Present, the user has not provided any feedback. A Mixed - Up and Down Vote status means the response received both positive and negative feedback from different users, indicating a varied reception.

upVote.title: Upvote
upVote.description: <bold>Upvote</bold> â€“ Indicates user approval or satisfaction with the response received.

downVote.title: Downvote
downVote.description: <bold>No Vote Present</bold> â€“ No feedback was given by the user for this response.

noVotePresent.title: No Vote Present
noVotePresent.description: <bold>Downvote</bold> â€“ Indicates user dissatisfaction with the response received.

mixedUpAndDownVote.title: Mixed - Up and Down Vote
mixedUpAndDownVote.description: <bold>Mixed - Up and Down Vote</bold> â€“ Represents responses that received both positive (upvotes) and negative (downvotes) feedback from users

queueAnalytics.infoTitle: This widget provides an overview of query handling across different queues. It displays the number of total, answered, pending, and rerouted queries, along with the average response time. Use this data to monitor efficiency and identify areas for improvement in query resolution.
queueAnalytics.question: Question

activeUserChat.title: Active Users & New Users
activeUserChat.tooltipDescription: This chart displays monthly statistics for both active and new users in the system:
activeUserChat.activeUsersDescription: Users who logged in and performed actions during the selected time period.
activeUserChat.newUsersDescription: First-time users who registered during the selected time period.

userRetentionAndChurnRate.title: User Retention and Churn Rate
userRetentionAndChurnRate.tooltipDescription: This chart tracks user retention and churn over time:
userRetentionAndChurnRate.monthRetentionDescription: Monthly percentages show how many users from a given month remained active in subsequent months.
userRetentionAndChurnRate.churnRateDescription: Churn rate indicates the percentage of users who stopped using the platform.
userRetentionAndChurnRate.newUsersDescription: First-time users who registered during the selected time period.
userRetentionAndChurnRate.monthlyRetentionDescription: Monthly percentages show how many users from a given month remained active in subsequent months.
userRetentionAndChurnRate.overallChurnRateDescription: Percentage of users who stopped using the platform.

topQuestionHandlers.infoTitle: This widget highlights the performance of team members handling queries. It shows the number of queries they have answered, ignored, and rerouted, along with their total actions. Use this data to assess individual contributions and optimize query management.

userEngagementRateAndRawQuestion.widgetHeaderTitle: User Engagement Rate and Raw Question
userEngagementRateAndRawQuestion.infoTitle: Represents the percentage of users actively interacting with the system, based on query submissions and responses.
